contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses}} {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Vianen | image_skyline = Vianen1.jpg | imagesize = | image_caption = | image_flag = Vianen vlag.svg | flag_size = 120x100px | image_shield = Flag of Vianen, Utrecht.svg | shield_size = 100x80px |image_map = LocatieVianen.png |mapsize = 250px |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_region = NL |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = [[Netherlands]] |subdivision_type1 = Province |subdivision_name1 = [[Utrecht (province)|Utrecht]] |area_footnotes = (2006) |area_total_km2 = 42.37 |area_land_km2 = 39.47 |area_water_km2 = 2.90 |population_as_of = 1 January 2007 |population_note = Source: [[Statistics Netherlands|CBS]], [http://statline.cbs.nl/ Statline]. |settlement_type = Municipality and city |population_total = 19677 |population_density_km2 = 499 |timezone = [[Central European Time|CET]] |utc_offset = +1 |timezone_DST = [[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] |utc_offset_DST = +2 |latd = 52 |latm = 0 |latNS = N |longd = 5 |longm = 6 |longEW = E }} '''Vianen''' ({{IPA-nl|viˈjaːnə(n)}}) is a [[municipality]] and a [[city]] in the central [[Netherlands]], in the province of [[Utrecht (province)|Utrecht]]. It is the only municipality in Utrecht located south of the [[Lek River]]. Before 2002 it was part of the province of [[South Holland]]. Vianen is bordered by two major [[motorway]]s leading to Utrecht: the [[A2 motorway (Netherlands)|A2]] (Amsterdam-Maastricht) on its west, and the [[A27 motorway (Netherlands)|A27]] (Breda-Almere) just east of the town. Both roads can be notoriously congested near Vianen during peak commute hours. ==Population centres == (links to additional info bolded) * [[Everdingen]] (1,287) * [[Hagestein]] (1,477) * '''Vianen''' (19,697) * [[Zijderveld]] (788) (Population as of February, 2006) == The city of Vianen == [[Image:Vianen.Lekpoort.jpg|thumb|left|130px|City gate (15th century)]] Vianen received [[City rights in the Netherlands|city rights]] in 1337. Vianen thrived under the counts of Brederode, who acquired its lordship through marriage early in the 15th century. It formed a self-proclaimed sovereign seignory till 1795, including Vianen, Lexmond, Hei- en Boeicop and Meerkerk. During the Middle Ages, as a "free city," Vianen could be a haven for felons and escaped serfs. Of the three castles built during the town's history, Castle Batestein was said to be one of the most beautiful in the Netherlands. Its only remnants are a 17th-century brick gate and water-pump. Remnants of the old city wall are visible girdling parts of the old downtown. Vianen celebrates its [[city rights]] every year in October with a horse-market. Besides the horses there are also other activities on this day, such as a fair and [[market]] and traditional Dutch games. ==Notable Vianen residents== *[[Frans van Brederode]] (1465 - 1490), military leader *[[Marian van de Wal]] (born 1970), singer *[[Jeannette Lewin]] (born 1972), hockey player *[[Joaquín Martínez]] (1930 - 2012), Mexican-born film and television actor, lived in [[Everdingen]]<ref name=thr>{{cite news|first=Mike|last=Barnes|title=Joaquin Martinez, a Warrior in Film and TV Westerns, Dies at 81 |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/joaquin-martinez-a-warrior-film-285199 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |publisher=2012-01-26 |date= |accessdate=2011-01-28}}</ref> == Gallery == <center> <gallery> File:Impressie Vianen 129.JPG File:Vianen 034.JPG File:VianenLangendijk 18.JPG File:Vianen Langendijk 56.JPG </gallery> </center> ==References== {{reflist}} == External links== {{commons category}} *[http://www.vianen.nl Official Website] *[http://www.plattegronden.nl/gemeentevianen/ Map] {{Geographic location | Centre = Vianen | North = [[IJsselstein]], [[Nieuwegein]]<br>''[[Lek (river)|Lek]]'' | Northeast = ''[[Lek (river)|Lek]]'' / [[Houten]] | East = [[Culemborg]] ([[Gelderland|GE]]) | South = [[Leerdam]] ([[South Holland|ZH]]) | Southwest = [[Zederik]] ([[South Holland|ZH]]) | Northwest = [[Lopik]] / ''[[Lek (river)|Lek]]'' }} {{Utrecht Province}} [[Category:Municipalities of Utrecht (province)]] [[Category:Populated places in Utrecht (province)]] [[Category:Cities in the Netherlands]]
